intro: Phasellus, commonly known as the common yarrow, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its flat, composite flower heads that consist of numerous small, tubular florets. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–100 cm and features finely divided, fern-like leaves. Phasellus is native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa, and it thrives in a variety of soil types. It is often used in traditional medicine and as a ornamental plant in gardens.
